The diagnosis of condyloma is a clinical diagnosis


- In men, if urethral involvement: +/- urethroscopy,

- In women: perform an FCV or HPV-HR test +/- colposcopy-biopsy

- In the event of anal involvement: full proctological examination

question.title: When diagnosing condyloma, what is the recommended procedure for women?
question.description: Select the correct diagnostic approach for women with condyloma.

option_a.title: Urethroscopy
option_a.description: A procedure that involves examining the urethra using a scope

option_b.title: HPV-HR test
option_b.description: A test that detects human papillomavirus (HPV) in cervical cells

option_c.title: Colposcopy-biopsy
option_c.description: A procedure that uses a special microscope to examine the cervix and take tissue samples

option_d.title: Proctoscopy
option_d.description: A procedure that examines the rectum using a scope
